meanings.definition: The act of withholding possession of property from the rightful owner.
meanings.sent1: The deforcements of the house caused a legal dispute between the siblings.
meanings.sent2: The court ruled in favor of the landlord in the case of deforcements by the tenant.
meanings.sent3: The deforcements of the treasure chest turned out to be a clever prank by the mischievous kids.
meanings.sent4: Her deforcements of the cookie jar were like a fortress protecting her favorite treats.
meanings.sent5: The image of deforcements was etched in his mind as a symbol of injustice.
